hu.elte.txtuml.api

Class Association

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.elte.txtuml.api.Association
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModelElement, hu.elte.txtuml.layout.lang.elements.LayoutAbstractLink, hu.elte.txtuml.layout.lang.elements.LayoutElement, hu.elte.txtuml.layout.lang.elements.LayoutLink, hu.elte.txtuml.layout.lang.elements.LayoutNonGroupElement

    public class Association
extends java.lang.Object
implements ModelElement, hu.elte.txtuml.layout.lang.elements.LayoutLink
    A base class for associations in the model.

    Represents: association

    Usage:

    An association in the model is a subclass of Association, having two inner classes which both extend AssociationEnd. These two inner classes will represent the two ends of this association. Their navigability and multiplicity depend on which predefined subclass of AssociationEnd is extended (it may not be the AssociationEnd class itself which is inherited).

    The two model classes which the association connects are defined by the two association ends' generic parameters.

    Java restrictions:

    • Instantiate: disallowed
    • Define subtype: allowed

      Subtype requirements:

      • must be the nested class of a subclass of Model
      • must have two inner classes which are subclasses of AssociationEnd

      Subtype restrictions:

      • Be abstract: disallowed
      • Generic parameters: disallowed
      • Constructors: disallowed
      • Initialization blocks: disallowed
      • Fields: disallowed
      • Methods: disallowed
      • Nested interfaces: disallowed
      • Nested classes: allowed at most two, both of which are non-static and are subclasses of AssociationEnd
      • Nested enums: disallowed
    • Inherit from the defined subtype: disallowed

    Example: 

     
 class SampleAssociation extends Association {
        class SampleEnd1 extends  Many<SampleClass1> {}
        class SampleEnd2 extends  HiddenOne<SampleClass2> {}
 }
    See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.
    Author:
    Gabor Ferenc Kovacs
    See Also:
    Association, Association.Many, Association.One, Association.MaybeOne, Association.Some, Association.HiddenMany, Association.HiddenOne, Association.HiddenMaybeOne, Association.HiddenSome

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Association.HiddenMany<T extends ModelClass>
      An immutable collection which contains the elements of a non-navigable association end with a multiplicity of 0..*.
      class  Association.HiddenMaybeOne<T extends ModelClass>
      An immutable collection which contains the elements of a non-navigable association end with a multiplicity of 0..1.
      class  Association.HiddenOne<T extends ModelClass>
      An immutable collection which contains the elements of a non-navigable association end with a multiplicity of 1.
      class  Association.HiddenSome<T extends ModelClass>
      An immutable collection which contains the elements of a non-navigable association end with a multiplicity of 1..*.
      class  Association.Many<T extends ModelClass>
      An immutable collection which contains the elements of a navigable association end with a multiplicity of 0..*.
      class  Association.MaybeOne<T extends ModelClass>
      An immutable collection which contains the elements of a navigable association end with a multiplicity of 0..1.
      class  Association.One<T extends ModelClass>
      An immutable collection which contains the elements of a navigable association end with a multiplicity of 1.
      class  Association.Some<T extends ModelClass>
      An immutable collection which contains the elements of a navigable association end with a multiplicity of 1..*.
